definition: to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head

sentences.english: Coal-fired power plants are factories of death.
sentences.chinese: 烧煤的火力发电厂堪称死亡工厂。

sentences.english: Each room was heated by an old-fashioned fireplace burning coal.
sentences.chinese: 各屋用老式的炉子烧煤取暖。

sentences.english: That's why we burn it to make electricity.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么我们烧煤用来发电。

sentences.english: Local residents sometimes burn coal to keep warm when temperatures drop.
sentences.chinese: 气温下降时，当地居民有时烧煤取暖。

sentences.english: They burned coal to heat the room.
This is a modern coal-burning electric power plant in Tientsin.
sentences.chinese: 这是天津的一座烧煤的现代化发电厂。

sentences.english: But sorry, it will still burn coal.
sentences.chinese: 然而遗憾的是，它还是要烧煤。

sentences.english: About half the electricity consumed in this country is produced in coal-fired power plants.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，烧煤的发电厂支撑着国家用电量的半壁江山。

definition: to warm oneself (by a fire etc)
to manufacture charcoal/to burn charcoal (often a reference to suicide by carbon monoxide poisoning)
